messages.message:
Feedback Search:

Some idea's one storing results

While it's great that the queries are being stored on the left hand side, this can easily be overwhelming when you have done 5+ queries. You likely will struggle to get any value from being able to jump back to your queries as that are not filterable, group-able or searchable them selfs.

Being able to either store a bookmark, or group queries into a folder for future reference.
Possible also considering if the underlaying documents have changed over time and such the queries result might require a rerun, showing that a query is "old" <timeframe> and is recommended to be rerun

The source Icon on a search response is always the document icon regardless of document type, xls, csv etc

@Mitch Welzen - thanks for the feedback. You can use the followup query feature to group queries into a project, similar to a Converse project. That way you wonâ€™t have 100s of different single search queries to sort through.

p.s. the fact that this was not obvious is a good usability feedback to us @tj.serkes @alagu
